smmaguire@utexas.edu
Github / Twitter

Research Interests

I'm interested in how neural circuits in the brain generate behavior. I'm interested in hormonal influcence on this process and how circuits of the brain evolve.

Publications

The Social and Ecological Costs of an 'Over-Extended' Phenotype.

Proceedings of the Royal Society B. In press.
Jordan A.J., Maguire S.M., Hofmann H.A., Kohda M.

Testing the Crticial Window Hypothesis of Timing and Duration of Estradiol Treatment on Hypothalamic Gene Networks in Reproductively Mature and Aging Female Rats.

Endocrinology 156: 2918-2933 (2015).
Yin W., Maguire S.M., Pham B., Garcia A.N., Dang N.V., Liang J., Wolfe A., Hofmann H.A., Gore A.C.

The C. Elegans Touch Response Facilitaes Escape from Predacious Fungi.

Current Biology 21: 1326-1330 (2011).
Maguire S.M.,Clark C.M., Nunnari J., Pirri J.K., Alkema M.J.

Employment and Lab experience

Lab technician and Research Associate (Dr. Mark Alkema's lab

Worcester, MA
2008-2010

I managed the ordering of supplies and other lab tasks. I worked on a variety of projects involving the neural molecular mechanisms of the C. elegans escape response.

Undergraduate Researcher (Dr. John Nambu's lab)

Amherst, MA
2008

I worked on a phylogenetics project involving the protein "Morgue" in Drosophila.
